author: uink45
content: Hi everyone, I have created my first development update for my chosen project "Research on the removal of the Gas Stipend". I would appreciate any feedback üôÇ . Link: https://hackmd.io/@7s45VWTfS62Y7oet2jJOgQ/HyT36Tk4t

author: jiekai9348
content: Is this about removing something like `.call{gas: 3000}`? Is there analysis about breaking old contracts? (just curious)

author: pipermerriam
content: I think these are two different things.  The think you link is about removing the `GAS` opcode, which removes the ability to observe how much gas is remaining for execution.  The "Gas Stipend" is a different thing, where all CALL style operations receive a default stipend of 2300 gas for awkward legacy reasons.

author: pipermerriam
content: Also, West standup call in 45 minutes.  Link will be posted prior to call.

author: jiekai9348
content: CALL style operations and the `.call()` are two different things? ü§Ø

author: pipermerriam
content: `.call()` does `CALL` I believe, but I can't remember whether the gas stipend applies to all of the CALL-style opcodes or just the specific CALL opcode (I think it is all of them)

author: pipermerriam
content:
There is a pattern/behavior that I've seen from a very small handful of program participants that I want to warn you all about.

You are all free to label yourselves as "part of the Core Developer Apprenticeship Program".  As I've said many times, there are no gates.  Titles can sound impressive.

But the reality is that titles don't mean much at all "here".  Junior/Senior ü§∑   Engineer/Developer/Student/TruckDriver ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è  Person/Dog/Dog-Person ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è .  You may be able to get some extra credibility by using this program as a way to acquire a fancier title or new resume item.  But this may also backfire on you.  It turns out people do sometimes check references.  Everything in CDAP happens in the "open" and it is pretty easy to come and look at the work you've done (or not done) as part of the program.  The best way to succeed here is to just do the work and do it well.

author: uink45
content: So the gas stipend only applies to non-zero value transfers when the EVM interprets the opcodes CALL and CALLCODE.

author: pipermerriam
content: Probably good to just ignore any specifics I laid out there because I haven't looked closely at the EVM rules surrounding this recently.
